data.title: About Us — Sanctum Media Group
data.meta_description: A multi-phased and diversified approach to leveraging the private capital markets.
data.text:
management bios

salvatore renaldi - chairman / ceo

Mr. Renaldi is the Founder and CEO of The Sanctum Group of Companies, Inc., majority shareholder and operator of Sanctum Media Group, Inc.

Mr. Renaldi is also currently the CEO of the Renaldi Group, Inc., a private equity investment firm headquartered in San Diego, California with a specific emphasis in first round bridge financing. Salvatore has over 30 years of experience in all phases of corporate finance and complex deal structure, as well as expertise in mergers and acquisitions, restructurings, venture funding and reverse merger transactions. Mr. Renaldi has served numerous industries spanning the globe including healthcare, biotechnology, information technology, consumer products, oil and gas, as well as alternative energy related companies.

Prior to the formation of the Renaldi Group, Inc., Mr. Renaldi was Managing Partner of S.R. Capital Corporation, an investment firm specializing in a variety of advisory services as a Merchant Bank with companies ranging from as early as startup to more seasoned and profitable enterprises. He has also managed and operated many successful sales and marketing campaigns over a span of more than 25 years.

Mr. Renaldi is a passionate Philanthropist involved in many charities, sits on various boards and steering committees, and is a Fourth Degree and highest order of the Knight of Columbus.

pierre parent - chief financial officer

Mr. Parent brings over 25 years of business and financial experience in the consumer electronics industry.

Mr. Parent was the former Vice President of financial operations of Mitac Digital Corp., the owner of the Magellan GPS. In addition to managing Finance he also led the Legal, Supply Chain, and Account Services groups. As a member of the Executive team he was engaged in the turn-around of the company by leading the business into new segments and improving cost position.

Previously Mr. Parent worked for Hewlett Packard, including time in HP’s personal computer, Desk Jet printing and digital photography business. Pierre was involved in growing the Desk Jet business from sales of $100M to over $5B. A few of his major contributions include leading the Finance team in the establishment of a Latin American manufacturing and distribution operation and providing the financial advice for HP’s acquisition of Snapfish.

Mr. Parent graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and has an MBA in finance.

DANIEL MONACO - MANAGING PARTNER

Mr. Monaco, formerly of Merrill Lynch and Merrill Edge, brings vast experience and a plethora of knowledge of all securities related matters. He is an expert in identifying and cultivating key business ideas, establishing roles and driving long term success for his clients. His well diversified background consists of crisis management, debt restructurings, debt consolidation, debt retirement strategies, and reorganizations.

While at Merrill Lynch Dan maintained his Series 7 and Series 66 licenses. His role at Merrill consisted of portfolio management, fundamental and technical analysis, equities trading, and financial advisory. By his 3rd year he ranked in the Top 200 producing representatives within the United States.

As Managing Director of Sanctum Solutions, Dan will oversee everything related to corporate introductions, business planning, deal structure, feasibility studies, Direct Public Offerings, and capital formation. He spearhead’s a division of seasoned representatives with our clients long term vision and goals in mind.

jessica donahue - director of business development & procurement

Jessica Donahue is a highly seasoned business development and client retention professional. She has expertise in identifying and capitalizing new and untapped market opportunities. She started her career at Pitney Bowes in Miami Lakes, Florida, where she was a Major Account representative. After 8 years, she left Pitney Bowes and ventured off to start her own Insurance company, Palm Beach Insurance Group. She was responsible in the start up and growth of this company as she managed a book of business exceeding $3.6 million dollars, trained sales team to exceed annual quotas and sales objectives, represented the company at national and regional insurance conventions and maintained a higher-than-industry-standard client retention ratio. In June of 2013, Ms. Donahue left the insurance industry to focus on Business Development with Zindigo Boutique. She worked as a Director of Business Development as she successfully directed all Marketing and Promotions. She is seasoned in all aspects of Social Media.

Ms. Donahue is the Director of Business Development at Sanctum Media Group, Inc. She will be responsible for lead generation, networking and relationship development, strategically launching new products/services to the market, plan and implement logistics in new territories, brand and reputation management as well as ensure high quality, unparalleled levels of customer service.

Ms. Donahue received her Bachelor’s degree from Florida Atlantic University in 1993.

JASON SALERNO - DIRECTOR OF SALES OF SANCTUM MOBILE MARKETING

Mr. Salerno, formerly of Fifth Third Bank, brings an array of knowledge and vast experience in sales, marketing, and managing various sales teams. Jason is an expert in identifying and closing key business opportunities, establishing roles and driving long term success for his sales teams. His experience consists of networking, sales leadership, mentoring, generating and increasing revenue.

While at Fifth Third Bank, Jason brought an underachieving office to become a consistent leader in the region. A branch that was typically at the bottom of national rankings, Jason achieved and surpassed goals set by superior officers to the tune of 125%. His team, month after month, reached the top of the leader boards. By his second year he was responsible for driving deposit growth from 15 million dollars to 40 million dollars. His additional roles at the bank consisted of increasing sales for qualifying loans, mortgages and managing a sales division of five employees.

As Director of Sales at Sanctum Mobile Marketing, Jason will oversee the internal sales division, be responsible for growth of an outside sales team and further develop proprietary verticals. Jason will implement new sales strategies, establish additional revenue streams and promote accountability and consistency.

karen HURLey - managing director of sanctum wealth generation

Ms. Hurley is the Managing Director of Sanctum Wealth Generation. She is responsible for business development, sales and marketing.

Karen has been employed in the financial service industry for many years. She has worked for prestigious companies such as, Bank Of America, AllState Financial Services and Northwestern Mutual. She has worked intimately with her clients in helping them to secure and accumulate wealth and protecting their families with life insurance.

While at Northwestern Mutual, Ms. Hurley was ranked the #4 sales producing woman and achieved the prestigious bronze status. While at Bank of America she consistently ranked amongst the top echelon of all bankers by achieving and surpassing monthly and quarterly growth goals. Ms. Hurley attended Bryant and Stratton college and obtained her Series 6 and Series 63 licenses.

ZACK NEUBERT - NATIONAL DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS OF SANCTUM MOBILE MARKETING

Zack brings nearly 10 years of experience in all aspects of marketing, sales, customer service, and account management. Prior to joining the Sanctum Mobile Marketing team, Zack managed offices and developed new markets for the Hertz Corporation, building relationships on the local level, as well as managing partnerships with major corporations both nationally and internationally; developing a track record for generating revenue and profits that far outpaced company standards and strategic projections.

Having seen all sides of business operations, from development of advertisement and marketing strategies on the agency level through to implementation on the ground, the targeting and sales to major accounts, and the fostering of relationships necessary for client retention, Zack will lend a keen eye and a unique insight to all customer and client relations. His breadth of knowledge, encompassing all facets of business infrastructure, will play an integral part in the growth and success of our Sanctum Mobile Marketing team.

Cortney graham - director of operations

Ms. Graham began her career working for Boston Financial Data Services as a Mutual Fund representative. She grew rich in knowledge within the industry learning about all products, services, 529 College Plans and ROTH / IRA accounts. She was responsible for daily communications with Broker Dealers and the coordination and set­up of various accounts. Her skills were further refined as an administrator for a private financial advisory firm. Her duties encompassed client services, development of system databases, monitoring of payables and receivables, and syncing calendars and schedules. Cortney’s talents will be instrumental in lending to customer support and relations, management of marketing representatives and demonstrating tutorials to our clients in utilizing our proprietary mobile technologies. Her experience will be invaluable in facilitating sales, client retention, and in establishing customer satisfaction as well as lending support with investor relations.
